issues_found.description: Package version mismatch for gql library - spec specified >=3.0.0 but research findings recommend >=3.5.0
issues_found.location: Line 76 (Files to Modify table, requirements.txt row) and Line 374 (Configuration Verification table)
issues_found.fix_applied: Updated all references from gql[all]>=3.0.0 to gql[all]>=3.5.0 to match research findings

issues_found.description: Package version mismatch for python-gitlab library - spec specified >=4.0.0 but research findings recommend >=4.4.0
issues_found.location: Line 76 (Files to Modify table, requirements.txt row) and Line 374 (Configuration Verification table)
issues_found.fix_applied: Updated all references from python-gitlab>=4.0.0 to python-gitlab>=4.4.0 to match research findings

issues_found.description: Missing critical warning that all package information requires verification before implementation. Research.json explicitly states 'REQUIRES_VERIFICATION' status and contains unverified claims section
issues_found.fix_applied: Added prominent warning box in Overview section alerting implementers that all packages, versions, API patterns, and endpoints must be verified against official documentation before implementation

issues_found.description: Missing Linear GraphQL client initialization code example. Research provides detailed initialization patterns for all APIs, but spec only showed FastAPI health check example
issues_found.fix_applied: Added new section '3. Linear GraphQL Client Initialization' with complete code example showing async transport setup, authentication, and sample query execution using gql library

issues_found.description: Implementation plan did not emphasize verification steps as first priority, despite research indicating all information is unverified
issues_found.fix_applied: Added two new steps at the beginning of Phase 1: 'VERIFY ALL PACKAGES' and 'VERIFY API DOCUMENTATION' to ensure verification happens before any code is written

critique_summary: Spec was well-structured and comprehensive, but had critical accuracy issues with package versions and a missing verification warning. Research findings specified gql>=3.5.0 and python-gitlab>=4.4.0, but spec used older versions (3.0.0 and 4.0.0). Most importantly, research explicitly marked all information as 'REQUIRES_VERIFICATION' but spec did not warn implementers about this. Fixed all version mismatches, added prominent verification warning in Overview, added Linear GraphQL initialization code example, and updated implementation plan to prioritize verification steps.
recommendations: Before implementation begins, manually verify each package on PyPI to confirm current versions and compatibility with Python 3.11+
Review official API documentation for Linear (developers.linear.app), GitHub, GitLab, and Slack to confirm authentication methods and endpoints haven't changed
Test webhook signature verification methods against official docs - security implementations may have evolved
Consider adding rate limit specifics once verified (research notes Linear's rate limits weren't specified)
When implementing, start with package verification as specified in updated Phase 1, before writing any integration code
